    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public static void setName(java.lang.String name1,
                           java.lang.String name2)
        Stores the names of the players so they can be used later on to generate the match history file.
        Parameters:
        name1 - Name of the player who plays black.
        name2 - Name of the player who plays white (can be left blank for singleplayer).

      • setTest

        public void setTest(boolean x)
        Parameters:
        x - true for test placements, false for real placements.

      • setTurn

        public void setTurn(int i)
        Changes the turn to a certain color.
        Parameters:
        i - 1 for white -1 or any other integer for black.

      • getNumberOfWhiteDisks

        public int getNumberOfWhiteDisks()
        Returns:
        the number of white disks currently on the board.

      • getNumberOfBlackDisks

        public int getNumberOfBlackDisks()
        Returns:
        the number of black disks currently on the board.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Returns:
        whether the move is valid or not.

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard()
        Returns:
        The current status of the Reversi board as a 2D array.

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(int[][] x)
        Sets the board to the input state.
        Parameters:
        x - A 2D array.

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers(int x)
        Parameters:
        x - the number of players participating in the game (1 or 2)

      • getPlayers

        public int getPlayers()
        Returns:
        the number of players participating in the game (1 or 2)

      • getFlipRow

        public int[] getFlipRow()
        Returns:
        The array where the x-coordinates of all flips are stored

      • getFlipColumn

        public int[] getFlipColumn()
        Returns:
        The array where the y-coordinates of all flips are stored

      • resetFlipArrays

        public void resetFlipArrays()
        Resets the two arrays where coordinates of all flips are stored and resets e, so that new flips will be stored at the beginning of the array again.

      • copyCurrent

        public void copyCurrent()
        Stores a copy of boardArray in copiedArray.

      • undo

        private void undo()
        Overwrites boardArray with copiedArray.

      • testPlace

        public void testPlace(int row,
                      int column)
        Places a white disk at the specified position in case the move is valid but restores the board to the state before the placement took place. Only works if it's whites turn since the method is only used by the AI.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • getRules

        public java.lang.String getRules()
        Returns:
        The games rules as a string.

      • placeDisk

        public void placeDisk(int row,
                      int column)
        Checks whether this move is valid, in case it is, places a white or black disk based on whose turn it is. Then proceeds to check all the possible flips and whether the game has ended. Finally displays the points of each color and changes the turn to the other color.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • placeRandom

        public void placeRandom()
        Places a disk of the color whose turn it is on the first valid position on the board.

      • showPoints

        public java.lang.String showPoints()
        Returns:
        the current number of white and black disks on the board. Also returns whose turn it is.

      • placeWhiteDisk

        private void placeWhiteDisk(int row,
                            int column)
        Places a white disk at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • placeBlackDisk

        private void placeBlackDisk(int row,
                            int column)
        Places a black disk at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) where a disk should be placed; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • flipDisk

        private void flipDisk(int row,
                      int column)
        Changes the color of a disk at the specified position
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) where a disk should be flipped; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) where a disk should be flipped; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • checkAllWhiteFlips

        private void checkAllWhiteFlips(int row,
                                int column)
        Checks for possible flips to white in all directions from the specified origin. Uses multiple if functions to avoid looking in directions where there can't be any flips.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • checkAllBlackFlips

        private void checkAllBlackFlips(int row,
                                int column)
        Checks for possible flips to black in all directions from the specified origin. Uses multiple if functions to avoid looking in directions where there can't be any flips.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • checkForWhiteFlips

        private void checkForWhiteFlips(int row,
                                int column,
                                int x,
                                int y)
        Checks for possible flips to white in a specified direction. For AI: Adds coordinates of all flips that take place to arrays.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.
        x - x and y are used to define the direction in which to check for flips, with S: x=1, y=0 E: x=0 y=1 N: x=-1, y=0 W: x=0, y=-1 SE: x=1, y=1 SW: x=1, y=-1 NE: x=-1, y=1 NW: x=-1, y=-1.
        y - x and y are used to define the direction in which to check for flips, with S: x=1, y=0 E: x=0 y=1 N: x=-1, y=0 W: x=0, y=-1 SE: x=1, y=1 SW: x=1, y=-1 NE: x=-1, y=1 NW: x=-1, y=-1.

      • checkForBlackFlips

        private void checkForBlackFlips(int row,
                                int column,
                                int x,
                                int y)
        Checks for possible flips to black in a specified direction.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.
        x - x and y are used to define the direction in which to check for flips, with S: x=1, y=0 E: x=0 y=1 N: x=-1, y=0 W: x=0, y=-1 SE: x=1, y=1 SW: x=1, y=-1 NE: x=-1, y=1 NW: x=-1, y=-1.
        y - x and y are used to define the direction in which to check for flips, with S: x=1, y=0 E: x=0 y=1 N: x=-1, y=0 W: x=0, y=-1 SE: x=1, y=1 SW: x=1, y=-1 NE: x=-1, y=1 NW: x=-1, y=-1.

      • checkMove

        private void checkMove(int row,
                       int column)
        Checks whether a move complies with the rules. The strategy is quite similar to the method used to check for flips.
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) where it should be checked whether placing a disk there is valid; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) where it should be checked whether placing a disk there is valid; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.

      • checkAllMoves

        private void checkAllMoves(int row,
                           int column,
                           int x,
                           int y)
        Parameters:
        row - The row (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: X.
        column - The column (0-7) around which flips should be checked; if the board had the coordinates x and y: Y.
        x - x and y are used to define the direction in which to check for flips, with S: x=1, y=0 E: x=0 y=1 N: x=-1, y=0 W: x=0, y=-1 SE: x=1, y=1 SW: x=1, y=-1 NE: x=-1, y=1 NW: x=-1, y=-1.
        y - x and y are used to define the direction in which to check for flips, with S: x=1, y=0 E: x=0 y=1 N: x=-1, y=0 W: x=0, y=-1 SE: x=1, y=1 SW: x=1, y=-1 NE: x=-1, y=1 NW: x=-1, y=-1.

      • pass

        public void pass()
        Changes turn to the other color. Adds 1 to passCount and checks if the game has ended.

      • validatePass

        public boolean validatePass()
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether there has been found a valid move (false) or not (true).

      • passIsValid

        public boolean passIsValid()
        Returns:
        true if the last pass was valid, false if not

      • checkEnd

        private void checkEnd()
        Displays the text 'Game has ended.' if both players passed after each other or if the sum of black and white disks is 64 and therefore the board is full.

      • evaluate

        private void evaluate()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Displays the text "White wins!", "Black wins!" or "Draw!" based on whose color has more disks on the board. Prints the result of the current match to matchhistory.txt and saves the number of disks of the winner to highscores.txt.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there's something wrong with the files.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Resets all variables so a new game can be started.
